intro: Melanthera gambica, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial, with compact foliage and blooms that range in color from purple to blue. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Melanthera gambica is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
